content.rendered:
What is a Product Manager?

Product Managers are responsible for the development of a given product as well as understanding the product’s features and strategy. Product Managers are often very involved in the product development process.

Where does a Product Manager work?

  • Tech companies
  • Finance and insurance companies
  • Construction companies

How much does a Product Manager make?

Based on real new grad salaries reported through Handshake, the median annual salary for a Product Manager is $58,000.

What majors are typically interested in becoming Product Managers?

One’s major doesn’t necessarily determine their career, but these are some common majors of those who end up pursuing this career path.

  • Business majors
  • Marketing majors
  • Finance majors
Search Product Manager jobs on Handshake

Product Manager skills and competencies

On top of a relevant degree and formal training, here are some professional skills that can help aspiring Product Managers succeed in their work:

  • Creativity
  • Team building and leadership skills
  • Organization and ability to execute visions

What are some common questions about Product Managers?

Q: What does a product management do?

A: Project management interns work with Product Managers on keeping project documentation, preparing reports, and other tasks related to research and data entry. These interns will be exposed to both the business and technical aspects of managing projects.

excerpt.rendered: Learn about the average salary, relevant studies, related questions, and common path after college to becoming a Project Manager.
